summary: This is an October 2020 email chain between DOJ and FBI officials discussing logistics for a briefing meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails coordinate location (preferably South Florida/Broward County), timing, and involvement of victims' attorneys Brad Edwards and Paul Cassell, while noting the U.S. Attorney's Office has been recused.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attorney representing Epstein victims; consulted on logistics for victim briefing meeting, suggesting Florida as the best location.

persons.name: Paul Cassell
persons.context: Attorney representing Epstein victims; consulted on logistics for victim briefing meeting, suggesting Florida as the best location.

connections.description: Both are attorneys representing victims of Jeffrey Epstein, coordinating together with the DOJ/FBI on victim briefing logistics.

events.title: Planning for Victim Briefing on OPR Findings
events.description: DOJ and FBI officials coordinate a meeting to brief victims of Jeffrey Epstein regarding the findings of an Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) investigation. Logistics include selecting South Florida as the preferred location.

locations: Miramar, Florida (FBI field office location mentioned)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) had been recused from matters related to the victim briefing on Epstein case OPR findings.
Victims' attorneys Brad Edwards and Paul Cassell preferred the briefing be held in South Florida, citing client locations and pandemic-related travel concerns.
The FBI Victim Services Division (VSD) was involved in planning support for the victim briefing.
The email chain indicates ongoing, high-level DOJ coordination (involving an Associate Deputy Attorney General) for victim outreach in the Epstein case years after his death.
A specific FBI building in Broward County (possibly the Miramar field office) was suggested as a potential venue.
